summary: The Tribal Tax and Investment Reform Act of 2025 aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code to treat Indian Tribal Governments similarly to State governments for certain federal tax purposes. The bill covers various aspects, including excise taxes, bond issuance, pension plans, charitable organizations, child support enforcement, adoption credit, new markets tax credit, difficult development areas, general welfare programs, employment tax credit, and exclusions from gross income for relevant programs. The goal is to enhance tribal self-governance and economic development while addressing historical disadvantages faced by tribes.
